answers.answer: Hi there. Severe itching or prickly skin can be seen in association with liver disease particularly obstructive jaundice. Symptoms and signs include jaundice due to increased bilirubin levels, coated tongue, itchy skin, dark circles around eyes, flushed face, dark urine, pale stools, easy bruisability, itching, spider like blood vessels, fluid in abdomen, tremors in hand. Other associated problems include digestive problems, blood sugar problems, immune disorders, abnormal fat absorption, metabolism problems. Nervous system problems include depression, mood swings, foggy brain, blood sugar problems and onset of type 2 diabetes. liver function tests need to be done to confirm for liver dysfunction like liver function tests, serum proteins, serum albumin and globulin, alanine transaminase, prothrombin time, partial thromboplastin time and platelet count. addison’s disease or underactive adrenal glands can cause hyper pigmented patches on skin, and mucosa like freckles on face, forehead, shoulders, nipples, lips, mouth, rectum, vagina etc. hope this helps. Take care.
